table.title: Processor GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Notes

entry.p: Total trace length
Total trace length options as below:
[1] Total trace length BO + M1 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or
[2] Total trace length BO + M2 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or
[3] Total trace length BO + Mn + BI =< 177.8 mm.
Strapping resistor, R_strap
20 kÎ© on need basis, for strapping purposes.
Resistor can be either pull-up or pull-down depending on strapping design.
Number of vias allowed
No restriction.
Reference plane
No restriction.
Note 1
R_strap resistor is optional depending on signal needs and can be anywhere along M1, M2, Mn lane.
Refer to EDS or device datasheet for the requirement.
Note 2
Main route of Mn can start anywhere along M1 as long as the total length of each branch from processor to device is less than 177.8 mm.
Note 3
R_strap resistor value depends on power sequence/ strapping's timing and DC voltage level requirement (refer below for calculation details).
Note 4
Level shifter may be needed depending on actual device implementation. Generally no length restriction after level shifter.
Note 5
For processor input-only signal, if device output is open drain buffer type, then proper pull-up resistor, Rpu is needed and refer to "Rise Time and R_strap or Rpu Calculation" section for details.
Note 6
Noise sensitive GPIO pin should be properly shielded/ with sufficient trace spacing (e.g.: 3x of trace width).
This is to prevent undesirable random system reset.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formula
Refer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, Cb
Device = 10 pF per device.
Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example
[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3 pF = 33 pF.
[2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF.
[3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us.
Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].
